segments.key_quote: Krishna is saying yes, you exist after life, after old age, after death.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Krishna's teachings on the soul, matter, and reincarnation, contrasting it with the limitations of scientific understanding.

And if the soul is energy, then the law of conservation of energy should hold good for the soul too. So that explains that yes, we do exist after life. And Krishna makes it more clear in the second chapter. In fact, the Bhagavad Gita starts from here. Second chapter, thirteenth sloka. Dehino asliyatha dehe ghaumaryam yoganam jara. Krishna is saying yes, there is a matter. Deha is the matter. And there is a Dehi, which is energy, superior energy. And this energy goes under transformations in different phases. Ghaumaryam, yoganam, jara. What happens next? What happens after jara, after old age? Ghaumaryam said the end. He didn't say the end. He says Dehantara. There is a transformation. segments.key_quote: Something which you cannot perceive by your senses can be perceived by the scriptures.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of scriptures as a source of knowledge beyond the limitations of the senses and scientific observation.

Pasyanti Gyan Chakshasa. By the eyes of Mahesh. Time of the word is Shastra Chakshasa. By the help of scriptures. That's where everything gets stuck. Because the whole process of scientific discoveries or understanding is based on observation. When I was in school, I remember in my science class, science when we go to the lab, we have a lab manual we used to write there. The first thing we write is observations. It starts with observation. Then comes the theory, then comes the experiment, then conclusion. And all our observations are limited by our senses. They are called Gyanendriyas. Knowledge acquiring senses. So whatever we know about our surroundings is because of these Gyanendriyas. They capture the information around the surrounding and that's how we get them out. And they are limited, so our observations are limited. They are faulty, so our observations are faulty. We cannot see everything with the eyes. And with the same eyes, we design telescopes. By this transcendental knowledge. Because this knowledge is absolute. This knowledge is perfect. This knowledge is beyond limits.
